headline: Tesla November car registrations drop in Europe markets, Norway shines
summary:
STORY: Tesla's troubles in Europe dragged on through November, data has shown.

Although there was one big bright spot in Norway.

Monthly new car registrations are seen as an indicator for sales.

Data showed monthly registrations were down 58% in France from a year ago.

They were also down close to half in Denmark, and 59% from a year earlier in Sweden.

The electric vehicle maker has struggled to turnaround market shares losses in Europe.

That's despite launching a new range of its best-selling Model Y.

Tesla's slowdown in Europe began late last year when CEO Elon Musk praised right wing political figures, which set off protests across the region.

Musk has gone relatively quiet on politics in recent months but Tesla's European business hasn't recovered.

Analysts further cited growing competition in the European market, especially from new Chinese entrants.

They also blamed Tesla's aging lineup.

There was a bright spot in Europe, though, as the EV maker sold more cars in Norway this year than any other automaker ever did in a full year.

It beat the country's annual sales record with one month to spare, with sales up more than a third in the country.

content.title: Tesla November car registrations drop in Europe markets, Norway shines
content.summary:
STORY: Tesla's troubles in Europe dragged on through November, data has shown.

Although there was one big bright spot in Norway.

Monthly new car registrations are seen as an indicator for sales.

Data showed monthly registrations were down 58% in France from a year ago.

They were also down close to half in Denmark, and 59% from a year earlier in Sweden.

The electric vehicle maker has struggled to turnaround market shares losses in Europe.

That's despite launching a new range of its best-selling Model Y.

Tesla's slowdown in Europe began late last year when CEO Elon Musk praised right wing political figures, which set off protests across the region.

Musk has gone relatively quiet on politics in recent months but Tesla's European business hasn't recovered.

Analysts further cited growing competition in the European market, especially from new Chinese entrants.

They also blamed Tesla's aging lineup.

There was a bright spot in Europe, though, as the EV maker sold more cars in Norway this year than any other automaker ever did in a full year.

It beat the country's annual sales record with one month to spare, with sales up more than a third in the country.

headline: Elon Musk says AI is 'the only thing' to 'solve' US $38T debt
summary: Tesla (TSLA) CEO and the world's richest man, Elon Musk, says artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics are "the only thing" that can "solve" the US national debt, which nears $38 trillion. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma, HSBC head of equity strategy for the Americas Nicole Inui, and Winthrop Capital chief investment officer Adam Coons join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to examine whether AI could actually address the debt crisis. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: Elon Musk says AI is 'the only thing' to 'solve' US $38T debt
content.description:
Tesla (TSLA) CEO and the world's richest man, Elon Musk, says artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics are "the only thing" that can "solve" the US national debt, which nears $38 trillion.

Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma, HSBC head of equity strategy for the Americas Nicole Inui, and Winthrop Capital chief investment officer Adam Coons join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to examine whether AI could actually address the debt crisis.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Electric Plane Maker Dubbed ‘Young Tesla’ Wins Over Analysts
summary: Most of the eight analysts who have initiated coverage on the South Burlington, Vermont-based company as of Dec. 1 have a buy-equivalent rating on shares, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.  Beta is “akin to a young Tesla, but with a more attractive end market of aerospace, which has higher barriers to entry than autos,” said Morgan Stanley analysts in a note.  The company, which develops both electric conventional takeoff and landing (eCTOL) aircraft and electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) models, is ahead of its peers as it gains traction across cargo, medical transport, passenger mobility and defense markets, according to analysts.

content.title: Electric Plane Maker Dubbed ‘Young Tesla’ Wins Over Analysts
content.summary: Most of the eight analysts who have initiated coverage on the South Burlington, Vermont-based company as of Dec. 1 have a buy-equivalent rating on shares, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. The company, which develops both electric conventional takeoff and landing (eCTOL) aircraft and electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) models, is ahead of its peers as it gains traction across cargo, medical transport, passenger mobility and defense markets, according to analysts.

headline: UMA Launches from Europe to Shape the Global Future of Physical AI
summary: PARIS, December 01, 2025--UMA (Universal Mechanical Assistant), a new robotics intelligence company founded by former leaders from Tesla, Google DeepMind, Nvidia and Hugging Face, launches today with a clear goal: to bring advanced AI into the physical world and build humanoid robots ready for real work, in real environments, at scale.

headline: How the Narrative for Tesla Is Evolving With Shifting Analyst Views and Recent Developments
summary: Tesla’s Fair Value Estimate remains steady at $392.93 per share. Analysts have updated their expectations for the company’s growth prospects. Recent adjustments reflect both increased revenue growth projections and a slightly higher discount rate, as experts continue to debate the factors shaping Tesla’s outlook. Stay tuned to discover how you can keep up with the latest shifts in Tesla’s ever-evolving investment narrative. Stay updated as the Fair Value for Tesla shifts by adding it to your...

headline: Changan Auto becomes latest mainland Chinese carmaker to join humanoid robot bandwagon
summary: Chinese carmakers, which are increasingly deploying robots in factories, are now moving into humanoid robotics following US rival Tesla despite a warning from Beijing about a potential investment bubble. State-owned Changan Automobile has become the latest entrant into the sector. The Shenzhen-listed company planned to invest 225 million yuan (US$31.8 million) for a 50 per cent stake in Changan Tianshu Intelligent Robotics Technology, according to an exchange filing on Friday. headline: Tesla valuation, Elon Musk's $1T pay called out by Michael Burry
summary: Michael Burry, best known for predicting the 2007 mortgage crisis, said Tesla (TSLA) is "ridiculously overvalued" and that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay package will further dilute the stock. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Pras Subramanian outlines everything investors need to know. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: Tesla valuation, Elon Musk's $1T pay called out by Michael Burry
content.description:
Michael Burry, best known for predicting the 2007 mortgage crisis, said Tesla (TSLA) is "ridiculously overvalued" and that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay package will further dilute the stock.

Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Pras Subramanian outlines everything investors need to know.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.
content.summary: Michael Burry, best known for predicting the 2007 mortgage crisis, said Tesla (TSLA) is "ridiculously overvalued" and that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay package will further dilute the stock. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Pras Subramanian outlines everything investors need to know. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.
